BANE_EVENT_2: Requires Level 99 in all base game Skills
BANE_EVENT_ARE_YOU_SURE: Are you sure you want to do this?
BANE_EVENT_START_TEXT_0: WARNING: You are about to begin the event for the Final Boss.
BANE_EVENT_START_TEXT_1: This event will lock all Combat content until it is either finished, you die, or ended by you.
BANE_EVENT_START_TEXT_2: Dying during this event will not result in account deletion.
BANE_EVENT_START_TEXT_3: The event will take roughly 2 hours to complete, depending on your gear setup, and you only need to complete it once to receive all possible rewards.
BANE_EVENT_START_TEXT_4: Dying or manually stopping via the button will result in the event ending.
BANE_EVENT_START_TEXT_5: You are able to train all Non-combat Skills, and close the game during the event. It will remember your progress upon returning.
BANE_EVENT_START_TEXT_6: Remember, you cannot train any Combat normally while the event is active.
BANE_EVENT_START_TEXT_7: Defeat all Monsters in the respective Slayer Areas, and fight your way through 5 cycles of chaos, mayhem and death.
BANE_EVENT_STOP_WARNING: WARNING: Stopping the event will make you lose all current progress in it.
BANK_STRING_10: Equip Item - Use Current Equipment Set as Default

BANK_STRING_51: Are you sure you want to lock all items in your Bank?

BANK_STRING_FOUND_A_FRIEND: You found a friend! A Friendship Bracelet has been added to your bank.
BIRTHDAY_EVENT_2023_CHALLENGES_DESCRIPTI: Complete these challenges to unlock the Birthday Gamemode!
BIRTHDAY_EVENT_2023_CHALLENGE_DESCRIPTIO: Place 1st and get an "S" ranked Fish for each difficulty.
You can find these in the Township Skill
BIRTHDAY_EVENT_2023_CHALLENGE_TITLE_4: Complete all 20 Township Birthday Event Tasks
BIRTHDAY_EVENT_2023_CLUE_SCROLL_1: Sometimes you're my friend, and sometimes you're not. Born and raised from the ground up, I provide much needed assistance, albeit underappreciated most of the time. I have a relatively short lifespan - 5 years to be exact.
BIRTHDAY_EVENT_2023_CLUE_SCROLL_2: I always seem to show up, even though you didn't invite me. When you think I'm gone, I just come back. Usually I'll bring friends, but they come later. You do your best to get rid of me, but nothing seems to keep me away.
BIRTHDAY_EVENT_2023_CLUE_SCROLL_3: What do you get when you cross 10 weird looking ducks with freshly baked goods?
BIRTHDAY_EVENT_2023_CLUE_SCROLL_4: Hidden from view, safe until found. A mirror is my weakness, but only from those with a sharp eye. I prefer a clean plate, nothing left behind.
BIRTHDAY_EVENT_2023_CLUE_SCROLL_5: Reduced to ashes, but not before night time. Swinging into action, I hope your balance is on point. Watch your step and don't forget to jump.
BIRTHDAY_EVENT_2023_CLUE_SCROLL_6: I hope you are observant. It's up to you now.

CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_EchoingRing: Gain +${modValue0}% Maximum Hit each time you hit with an attack, stacking up to ${maxStacks} times (Stacks reset on a miss)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_FREEZE_ON_HIT: +${chance}% chance to apply Freeze for ${turns} Attack turn(s) when hitting with an attack
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_FROSTBURN_REFLECT: +${chance}% chance to inflict Frostburn on the Attacker when hit by an attack (once per turn)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_Fear_Enhancement_3: -${modValue0}% Enemy Accuracy Rating per attack turn (Stacks up to ${maxStacks} times)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_Fear_Enhancement_Super: +2% chance to apply Slow, per Attack Turn, stacking up to 5 times (Stacks reset to 0 at maximum stacks)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_FracturedBeastShield: Start each fight with +10% Abyssal Resistance. Lose 1% Abyssal Resistance each Attack Turn until the bonus is zero.
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_Gods_Enhancement_Super: +${modValue0}% Maximum Hit while the target is Stunned per attack turn (Stacks up to ${maxStacks} times)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_HitWithAttack_DamageTy: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hitting with an attack when using ${condDamageType}
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_HitWithAttack_MELEE: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hitting with a Melee attack
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_HitWithAttack_MELEE_RA: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hitting with a Melee or Ranged attack
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_HitWithAttack_Magic_Da: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hitting with a Magic attack when using ${condDamageType1}
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_HitWithAttack_Melee_Da: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hitting with a Melee attack when using ${condDamageType1}
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_HitWithAttack_RANGED: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hitting with a Ranged attack
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_HitWithAttack_Ranged_D: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hitting with a Ranged attack when using ${condDamageType1}
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_HitWithFirstAttack_Dam: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hitting with the first attack of a fight when using ${condDamageType}
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_MELEE_STUN_THRESHOLD: While you are using Melee attack type: Enemies are Stunned for 1 Attack turn when they deal damage greater than 30% of your maximum hitpoints
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_Magic_Enhancement_Supe: +${modValue0}% Evasion Rating per attack turn (Stacks up to ${maxStacks} times)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_Melee_Stun_DamageType: +${chance}% chance to stun when hitting with a Melee attack when using ${condDamageType1}
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_NULLED_ON_ATTACK: +${chance}% chance to apply Nulled (Prevents the Target from applying buffs or modifier effects to themself) for ${turns} turns when attacking
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_Nightmare_Enhancement_: +${chance}% for an enemy attack to deal no damage and reflect +${modValue0}% of the original damage
+2% chance to apply Sleep, per Attack Turn, stacking up to 5 times (Stacks reset to 0 at maximum stacks)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_ObsidianMoonstoneAmule: Start each fight with +100% Accuracy Rating. Lose 20% Accuracy Rating each Attack Turn until the bonus is zero.
Start each fight with +200% Accuracy Rating. Lose 40% Accuracy Rating each Attack Turn until the bonus is zero.
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_ObsidianShadowPearlAmu: +${modValue0}% Global Evasion and +${modValue1}% Maximum Hitpoints when you evade an attack (Stacks up to ${maxStacks} times). Stacks reset when hit by an attack.
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_ObsidianVoidheartRingI: +${modValue0}% Abyssal Resistance and +${modValue1}% Lifesteal when hit by an attack (Stacks up to ${maxStacks} times)
+${modValue0}% Abyssal Resistance, +${modValue1}% Lifesteal and +${modValue2}% Global critical hit chance when hit by an attack (Stacks up to ${maxStacks} times)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_ObzurianUnbreakableDef: +${modValue0}% Abyssal Resistance, +${modValue1}% Reflect Damage and -${modValue2}% Maximum Hit when hit by an attack (Stacks up to ${maxStacks} times)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_Overlords_Enhancement_: +2% chance to convert a miss into a successful hit, stacking up to 5 times
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_PostAttack_RANGED: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when attacking with Ranged
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_PostAttack_RANGED_Dama: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when attacking with Ranged using ${condDamageType0}
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_SHOCK_ON_ATTACK: +${chance}% chance to apply Shock (Reduce Target Damage Reduction by 2%) when attacking. Stacks up to 10 times.
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_SLEEP_ON_HIT: +${chance}% chance to apply Sleep for ${turns} Attack turn(s) when hitting with an attack
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_SLEEP_REFLECT: +${chance}% chance to apply Sleep to the Attacker for 1 Attack turn when hit by an attack
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_SLIMED_REGEN: Heal for 1% of current Hitpoints every 0.2s
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_SLOW_ON_HIT: +${chance}% chance to apply a ${magnitude}% Slow for ${turns} Attack turn(s) when hitting with an attack
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_SLOW_WHEN_HIT: +${chance}% chance to apply a ${magnitude}% Slow for ${turns} Attack turn(s) when hit by an attack
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_STUN_ON_HIT: +${chance}% chance to apply Stun for ${turns} Attack turn(s) when hitting with an attack
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_STUN_ON_MELEE_HIT: +${chance}% chance to apply Stun for ${turns} Attack turn(s) when hitting with a Melee attack
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_Silence: Silenced for 1 turn at the start of a fight
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_Sovereignty: Gives the enemy +2% Maximum Hit, +2% Maximum Hitpoints, +2% Accuracy Rating, and +2% Global Evasion each turn (Stacks up to 50 times). Lasts until the end of the fight.
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_StackOnMeleeHit: +${chance}% chance to apply a stack of ${effectName} when hitting with a Melee attack
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_TortoiseShellPlatebody: When hit, gain +2% Abyssal Resistance, stacking up to 3 times (lasts until the end of the fight)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_Undead_Enhancement_Sup: +${modValue0}% Accuracy Rating per attack turn (Stacks up to ${maxStacks} times)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_VoidShamblerCape: When hit, gain +1% Abyssal Resistance and +2% Lifesteal, stacking up to 5 times (lasts until the end of the fight)
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_WitheredGuard: Starts the fight with +10% Abyssal Resistance. Loses 1% Abyssal Resistance each Attack Turn until the bonus is zero.
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_WoefulGloves: Gives the enemy -5% Maximum Hit for 5 of their turns at the start of a fight
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_WoefulPlatebody: Gives the enemy -1% Maximum Hit when you are hit by an attack (stacks up to 5 times). Lasts until the end of the fight
CUSTOM_APPLICATOR_WrathObelisk: At the start of a fight: Enemies have -5% Maximum Hitpoints

EFFECT_APPLICATOR_HitByFirstAttack: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hit by an attack (once per turn)
EFFECT_APPLICATOR_HitWithAttack: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hitting with an attack
EFFECT_APPLICATOR_HitWithFirstAttack: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hitting with an attack (once per turn)
EFFECT_APPLICATOR_PostFirstAttack: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when attacking (once per turn)
EFFECT_APPLICATOR_StartOfFight: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} at the start of a fight
EFFECT_APPLICATOR_SummonAttack: +${chance}% chance to apply ${effectName} when hitting with a summon attack

GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_DESC_Adventure: For experienced Melvor Idle players. A completely different experience for you to enjoy.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_DESC_AncientRelics: Locate powerful Ancient Relics in this chaotic Melvor Idle experience.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_DESC_Chaos: How fast can you beat the game? Have a go with this calm & peaceful Melvor Idle experience.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_DESC_Hardcore: For those who enjoy risk, and are not afraid to lose your Character. This is not for new players.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_DESC_Standard: For players new to Melvor Idle. This is the standard way to play.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_MISC_2: This Gamemode will require some active gameplay to progress.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_NAME_HCCOARSpeedrun: Hardcore Ancient Relics Combat Only Speedrun
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_Adventure_0: Skills are locked and must be purchased using GP to access.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_Adventure_1: Non-Combat Skill Levels cannot go above your Combat Level.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_Adventure_2: Start with only Melee Combat Skills, a Bronze Weapon and 10 Basic Food.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_Adventure_3: Harsher penalties applied against you in Combat.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_Adventure_4: HP, Damage and Food Healing values are 10x larger than Standard.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_AncientRelics_0: Harsher penalties applied against you in Combat.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_AncientRelics_1: All preservation and doubling is disabled.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_AncientRelics_2: Dungeons also provide Food Crates upon completion as a reward.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_AncientRelics_3: Fishing and Cooking are locked until completion of Impending Darkness
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_AncientRelics_4: Combat Levels, except Prayer and Slayer, automatically increase when defeating a Dungeon.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_AncientRelics_5: Defeat Dungeons to increase Maximum Skill Level for randomised Skill (Choice of 2).
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_AncientRelics_6: Maximum Skill Levels are capped at Level 10.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_AncientRelics_7: Ancient Relics can be located in all Skills to gain unique permanent modifiers (6 per Skill).
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_Chaos_1: 25% Reductions on Attack Intervals and Skill Intervals (Multiplicative).
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_Chaos_2: All Enemies have at least 1 random Passive.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_Chaos_3: All equipped items lost on death.
GAMEMODES_GAMEMODE_RULES_Chaos_6: Harsher penalties applied against you in Combat.

Final Boss requires Level 99 in all Combat Skills to access.
All Skills except Firemaking & Farming are unlocked in the beginning.
Your Skill level is capped at Level 10. This cap can be increased by permanently disabling any non-Combat Skill (Maximum 10, not including Firemaking or Farming).
Each disabled Skill increases the Skill Level cap by 10.
You can disable Skills at any time.
-80% Attack Interval for you and the Enemies.
GAME_GUIDE_10: This new Bank Sidebar allows for easy scaling with new mechanics and ideas around items.
GAME_GUIDE_100: Allotments can be used as a basic source of Food to restore your Hitpoints.
GAME_GUIDE_103: Standard Two-Handed Ranged Weaponary. Requires Arrows as Ammo.
GAME_GUIDE_105: Ammo required for Shortbows & Longbows. Standard damage output.
GAME_GUIDE_107: One-Handed Ranged Weaponary. Requires Gem-Tipped Bolts as Ammo.
GAME_GUIDE_109: Ammo required for Crossbows. High damage output.
GAME_GUIDE_11: You are also able to see the Item Stats for the selected item, as well as change settings relating to the bank including New Bank Sorting Options.
GAME_GUIDE_111: Acts as both a Weapon and Ammo. Standard damage output.
GAME_GUIDE_112: Fletching is your gateway to training Ranged Combat, providing all required resources necessary to progress.
GAME_GUIDE_113: Used to create Armour for Ranged Combat, as well as Jewellery for general Combat bonuses.
GAME_GUIDE_115: Very Basic Defensive gear, suitable for Ranged Combat Training.
GAME_GUIDE_117: Strong Defensive gear, suitable for Ranged Combat Training.
GAME_GUIDE_119: All purpose Combat Jewellery. Be sure to read the bonuses some of these items provide.
GAME_GUIDE_12: On Mobile devices, this Bank Sidebar will pop-out for you when selecting an item.
GAME_GUIDE_120: Crafting provides the necessary Armour for Ranged Combat.
GAME_GUIDE_121: The Jewellery is a great starting point to aid with Combat in general.
GAME_GUIDE_122: Used to create Runes for Magic Combat & Alt. Magic, as well as Magic Weapons & Gear to assist with your adventure.
GAME_GUIDE_124: Your basic Runes. Required to cast any form of Magic Spell.
GAME_GUIDE_126: These are a combined Elemental Rune. An alternative to Standard Runes that can be more efficient at times.
GAME_GUIDE_128: Required to cast Magic Spells in Combat. Provides Rune reduction cost for most Magic Spells.
GAME_GUIDE_13: Another new option you get is the ability to Bulk Sell All of your items.
GAME_GUIDE_130: All purpose Magic Combat Gear. Provides elemental damage bonuses respective to their base.
GAME_GUIDE_132: Runecrafting is your gateway to training Magic, providing all required resources necessary to progress.
GAME_GUIDE_133: Brew countless Potions that provide benefits to all Skills within the game by using Herbs you grow within Farming.
GAME_GUIDE_134: Potions can be activated by selecting the Potion Button in the top right of the screen on the respective page associated with that Potion.
GAME_GUIDE_136: Provides bonuses for all Combat Skills. Only one Potion may be active at a time in Combat.
GAME_GUIDE_138: Provides bonuses for all non-Combat Skills. One Potion per non-Combat Skill can be active at any given time.
GAME_GUIDE_14: By simply activating the option at the top of the Bank, you will be able to mark any unlocked item for Sale to quickly remove them from your Bank.
GAME_GUIDE_140: Herblore interacts with every Skill within the game.
GAME_GUIDE_141: Construct your very own Obstacle Course to provides many different Global Active Passives to your Character.
GAME_GUIDE_143: You can build up to 10 different Obstacles, categorized into their own sections of the Obstacle Course.
GAME_GUIDE_144: You may destroy and swap Obstacles as you wish.
GAME_GUIDE_145: Obstacles will become inactive if there is a gap in your Obstacle Course. This means the Global Active Passives will become Inactive. The game will tell you when this happens.
GAME_GUIDE_147: At Level 99 Agility, you unlock a Passive Pillar.
GAME_GUIDE_148: These provide Global Active Passives just like Obstacles do, but are not actually an Obstacle that you must complete.
GAME_GUIDE_149: These are only active when all 10 Obstacles are built.
GAME_GUIDE_15: Combat provides a in-depth experience for those who enjoy high risk, high reward.
GAME_GUIDE_150: Discover Marks, create and Summon Familiars, and unlock Synergies to assist you throughout the entire game.
GAME_GUIDE_152: Discovering Marks is the first step in your Summoning journey.
GAME_GUIDE_153: These can be discovered by performing any action in the Skill that the Mark defines. Continue to perform actions in this Skill to find more Marks, and level up.
GAME_GUIDE_154: Having the respective Familiar equipped will double the Mark's drop rate.
GAME_GUIDE_155: Note: You must create at least 1 Summoning Tablet for this Mark to find more after the first one is found.
GAME_GUIDE_157: Continue to level up your Marks to unlock Synergies between other Familiars.
GAME_GUIDE_158: Equipping two Familiars with an unlocked Synergy will grant an extra bonus on top of their existing passives.
GAME_GUIDE_159: Familiars use an extra 1 charge each per action with the Synergy active.
GAME_GUIDE_16: With a selection of 3 different Attack Styles, and an assortment of Enemies and Dungeons to encounter, you will be required to test your Skill to master what there is to come.
GAME_GUIDE_162: Discovering 1 Mark will allow you to create Summoning Tablets. These Tablets can then be equipped from the Bank to provide passive bonuses for you.
GAME_GUIDE_163: Familiars use 1 charge per action in its relative Skill. Combat Familiars uses 1 charge each time it attacks in Combat.
GAME_GUIDE_164: Alt. Magic is a secondary method to progress in the Magic Skill using non-Combat abilities. You are still training Magic as a whole.
GAME_GUIDE_165: All Alt. Magic Spells require Runes created in Runecrafting to cast. Some Spells also require you to select an item by clicking on the Magic Hat image.
GAME_GUIDE_166: There are no Extra Items in Alt. Magic.
GAME_GUIDE_167: Because you're training the exact same Skill, progressing in Alt. Magic can also unlock all the Milestones available for Magic Combat.
GAME_GUIDE_168: This Page details many different Statistics that is tracked within the game.
GAME_GUIDE_169: This Page provides you with options to toggle various elements of the game on and off. This includes general gameplay settings, interface and account settings.
GAME_GUIDE_170: Be sure to always check back here every update in case something new has arrived!
GAME_GUIDE_171: Cooking is your go to source for Food, which is used to provide healing in Combat and Thieving.
GAME_GUIDE_174: For cooking all Fish and Beef products.
GAME_GUIDE_176: For cooking Bread, Chicken, Pizza, Pies, Cupcakes & Cakes.
GAME_GUIDE_18: Each Level increases your Melee Accuracy Rating (Higher chance to hit). Increasing Attack Levels also unlocks more powerful Melee Weapons for you to Equip.
GAME_GUIDE_180: When Active Cooking, you have a chance to receive a Perfect Version of that Product.
GAME_GUIDE_181: Perfect Items provide +10% Hitpoints Healing Value, and +50% Base Sale Price.
GAME_GUIDE_184: The standard way to cook Food. Only one product can be Active Cooked and any given time.
GAME_GUIDE_185: Grants Skill XP, Mastery XP, Mastery Pool XP, Perfect Items and rare Skill Item Drops.
GAME_GUIDE_187: You are able to Passive Cook a product at the same time you are Active Cooking. Passive Cooking can only be done on Cooking Utilities that are not currently in use.
GAME_GUIDE_188: Products that are Passive Cooking take much longer to Cook than Active Cooking.
GAME_GUIDE_189: Cooked Products from Passive Cooking are added to your Stockpile ready to collect when you wish.
GAME_GUIDE_19: Each Level increases your Maximum Hit for Melee. Sometimes it takes more than one Level to increase the Maximum Hit.
GAME_GUIDE_190: If you stop Active Cooking, all Passive Cooking will also stop.
GAME_GUIDE_191: No Skill XP, Mastery XP, Mastery Pool XP, Perfect Items and rare Skill Item Drops.
GAME_GUIDE_192: No Item Doubling or Skill Preservation is enabled with Passive Cooking.
GAME_GUIDE_193: The Bank is one of the most important aspects of the game. This is where all your items are stored for use.
GAME_GUIDE_194: You start out with very limited bank space, but you can buy more within the Shop!
GAME_GUIDE_196: Smelt Ores obtained from Mining to create Bars that are then used to smith various Combat Gear.
GAME_GUIDE_20: Each Level increases your Evasion Rating for Melee, Ranged and Magic (Higher chance to evade Enemy hits). Increasing Defence Levels also unlocks more powerful Armour for you to Equip.
GAME_GUIDE_202: There are 3 different Cooking Utilities provided for you to use, each housing unique Food that can be produced.
GAME_GUIDE_21: Each Level increases your Maximum Hitpoints. For Standard Players, your Health Regenerates over time.
GAME_GUIDE_22: Each Level increases your Ranged Accuracy Rating. Increasing Ranged Levels also unlocks more powerful Ranged Weapons & Armour for you to Equip.
GAME_GUIDE_23: Each Level increases your Magic Accuracy Rating and your Magic Evasion Rating. Increasing Magic Levels also unlocks more powerful Magic Spells, Weapons & Armour for you to Equip and Use.
GAME_GUIDE_24: Prayers are active Buffs you can apply to yourself at the cost of Prayer Points. Prayer Points are obtained by burying Bones from the Bank that you collect by slaying Enemies.
GAME_GUIDE_25: Prayer Skill XP can only be granted using Active Prayers that specify that they provide Prayer Skill XP.
GAME_GUIDE_26: Slayer is a Skill where you are given a Task to complete. This Task involves the Slaying of selected Enemies.
GAME_GUIDE_27: Slaying Enemies from your Slayer Tasks grant Slayer Coins which can be spent within the Shop to unlock more Weapons & Armour.
GAME_GUIDE_28: Slayer Skill XP is earned by defeating Slayer Task Enemies, or by simply slaying Enemies within Slayer Areas.
GAME_GUIDE_31: The Maximum Amount of Damage you deal per Attack.
GAME_GUIDE_33: This is your % chance to land a hit.
GAME_GUIDE_35: The number that determines your Chance to Hit. The goal is to keep this number higher than the Enemy's Evasion Rating for the Attack Type you are currently using.
GAME_GUIDE_37: The % amount of Damage that is ignored from Enemy Attacks.
GAME_GUIDE_38: This number determines the Enemy's chance to hit you. The goal is to keep the Evasion number for the Enemy's Attack Type higher than the Enemy's Accuracy Rating.
GAME_GUIDE_4: Every one is provided 10 Bank tabs to organise their inventory. These tabs allow for easy organisation, as well as quick access to items you need.
GAME_GUIDE_40: Monsters have varying Attack Styles. These Attack Styles determine Modifiers to your Maximum Hit and Damage Reduction.
GAME_GUIDE_41: Cut down various Trees to receive Logs that can be used throughout different Skills as a resource.
GAME_GUIDE_42: Woodcutting is also a great starting point to receive Seeds for Farming.
GAME_GUIDE_45: There is a small chance to receive a Bird Nest when cutting down Trees. These can be opened in the Bank to receive various Allotment or Tree Seeds that can be planted in Farming.
GAME_GUIDE_46: Logs are the main resource used in Firemaking to progress the skill.
GAME_GUIDE_47: Logs are one of the main resources required for most items in Fletching. These items are used for Ranged Combat training.
GAME_GUIDE_48: Plant the Allotment & Tree Seeds received from Bird Nests to progress.
GAME_GUIDE_49: Catch various Raw Fish within many different locations that can be used in Cooking.
GAME_GUIDE_5: For Desktop users, you are able to drag any item into any tab you wish. For everyone else, there is an option at the top of the bank to quickly move items into new tabs. Kind of like a Bulk Move Item mode.
GAME_GUIDE_50: Be sure to have quite a few spare Bank Slots to accomodate for all the possible items you can get.
GAME_GUIDE_51: Be sure to look out for Special Items that you can catch. Some unlock access to secret Fishing Areas! There's also some rare items you can equip that provide bonuses to Skills.
GAME_GUIDE_54: Those unskilled in Fishing have a tendency to lure a few useless items known as Junk.
GAME_GUIDE_55: Fish is the main resource used in Cooking. Cooked Fish can be eaten during Combat or Thieving to provide healing. This is how you survive your adventure.
GAME_GUIDE_56: Junk items can be converted to Gems using the correct Alt. Magic Spell.
GAME_GUIDE_57: Burn Logs obtained from Woodcutting to progress.
GAME_GUIDE_58: Firemaking's main purpose is to provide Global bonuses to other Skills.
GAME_GUIDE_59: Burnt Logs have a chance to provide Coal Ore.
GAME_GUIDE_6: The first item within the Tab determines the image that is displayed.
GAME_GUIDE_60: Progressing in Firemaking will allow you to purchase Cooking Fires from the Shop. These provide huge increases in Cooking Skill XP.
GAME_GUIDE_61: Mine various types of Rocks to receive resources that can be used to progress in Smithing and Runecrafting
GAME_GUIDE_62: These Rocks only provide a set amount of resources until they become depleted. They will respawn after a certain period of time (Between 2 seconds and 2 minutes).
GAME_GUIDE_64: There is a small chance per action to receive a random Gem.
GAME_GUIDE_65: Use the Ores collected to Smelt Bars, that can then be used to create various Combat Gear.
GAME_GUIDE_66: Rune Essence is the main resource used to progress in Runecrafting, which is required to progress Magic.
GAME_GUIDE_67: Gems collected from Mining can be used to create Gem-Tipped Bolts, providing a high damage option for Ranged Combat Training.
GAME_GUIDE_68: You can also use these Gems to craft various types of Jewellery that provide Combat bonuses.
GAME_GUIDE_69: Smith all types of Melee Armour - Helmets, Platebodies, Platelegs, Boots & Gloves.
GAME_GUIDE_7: The Bank is separated into two sections: The Main Container and the Bank Sidebar.
GAME_GUIDE_70: Smith all types of Melee Weapons - Daggers, Swords, Scimitars, Battleaxes and 2-Handed Swords.
GAME_GUIDE_71: Required to create Arrows in Fletching.
GAME_GUIDE_72: Required to create Javelins in Fletching.
GAME_GUIDE_73: Required to create Crossbows in Fletching.
GAME_GUIDE_74: Required to create Gem-Tipped Bolts in Fletching.
GAME_GUIDE_75: Smithing is one of the main Skills used to create Melee Combat Gear. This is used to train Attack, Strength, and Defence.
GAME_GUIDE_76: All items in Fletching (Except Shortbows and Longbows) require resources obtained via Smithing.
GAME_GUIDE_77: Silver and Gold Bars are required to craft Jewellery.
GAME_GUIDE_78: Pickpocket NPCs to gain GP as well as various items. Be sure to pay attention to your Hitpoints as NPCs may spot you and stun you, dealing damage in the process.
GAME_GUIDE_8: The Main Container is just like it has always been, the section that stores all your items.
GAME_GUIDE_80: A good thief never gets caught. In order to accomplish this, you need to increase your Stealth.
GAME_GUIDE_81: Stealth can be increased in a number of ways:
GAME_GUIDE_88: Your Stealth competes against an NPC's Perception
GAME_GUIDE_89: Your success rate is determined by: 100 x (100 + Stealth) / (100 + Perception) %
GAME_GUIDE_9: The Bank Sidebar - Selecting an item will display this sidebar with all details and actions relating to your item.
GAME_GUIDE_90: Your chance to double items is increased by: 25 x (Stealth / Perception) %
GAME_GUIDE_91: Your chance to receive an NPC's unique item is: ((100 + Stealth) / Perception) / 100 %
GAME_GUIDE_92: Pickpocketting the Farmer NPC has a chance to provide a Herb Sack. These can be opened via the Bank to receive random Herb Seeds that can be planted in Farming.
GAME_GUIDE_93: There are several unique Items you can obtain via Thieving. Be sure to watch out for them.
GAME_GUIDE_94: You might discover some unique materials that can be used to craft bags that enhance other skills.
GAME_GUIDE_95: Plant your Allotment, Herb or Tree Seeds to produce their grown counter-part. Crops have a 50% chance to die if Compost or Weird Gloop is not used.
GAME_GUIDE_96: Allotments can be used as a source of Food. Herbs are used to create Potions in Herblore, and Trees are the main source of Skill XP in Farming.
GAME_GUIDE_97: You are able to perform all Farming actions alongside any other Skill.
GAME_GUIDE_98: There are no Extra Items in Farming.
GAME_GUIDE_99: Herbs are the main resource required to create any Potion within Herblore.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_0: Excavate Dig Sites located in Cartography to discover an assortment of rare and unique items which will provide great assistance for your progression outside of the Skill.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_10: There is a limit on how many Maps you can have created at any given time for a Dig Site. This number starts at 1, and increases as you progress through the use of Shop Purchases.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_11: If you run out of actions on a Map, it will automatically begin using the next Map in order until all Maps are depleted in which the Skill will then stop.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_13: You will notice there are 4 different types of Tools that you can toggle in Archaeology. These tools determine the size of the Artefacts that you are digging for.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_18: You may have any assortment of Tools active while excavating. The more tools you have selected, the less chance there is to obtain specific sized Artefacts.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_2: These are the areas in which you will be excavating for items.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_20: The chance to obtain Artefacts are determined by their rarity. There are 5 rarities:
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_21: Not every Dig Site will have an item for every single rarity. You can view the undiscovered items breakdown for a Dig Site by clicking the "Show Artefacts" button.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_23: The Grand Museum of Melvor has enlisted you to locate and recover lost Artefacts by exploring Archaeological Dig Sites in and around Melvor, and in return, you will be rewarded for donating these Artefacts to the Museum.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_25: You must donate at least 1 of every single Artefact located in Archaeology to the Museum. When donating the Artefact, it will be removed from your Bank and will forever sit inside the Museum.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_26: To donate an item, just click it in the museum. There museum will indicate what Artefacts have already been donated, and which ones are sitting in your Bank waiting to be donated.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_27: It is a requirement for completion that every single item in Archaeology is donated to the Museum.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_29: For every 10 or so Artefacts that you donate, you will be rewarded with GP or Items (Like Bank Slot Tokens).
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_4: You must first locate the Dig Site in Cartography to unlock it.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_5: You also need the required Archaeology Level.
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_7: Before you can begin excavation, you must first create Maps of the Dig Site within Cartography (See above details about how to do this).
GAME_GUIDE_ARCHAEOLOGY_8: Once you have your Maps, you can return and begin excavation.
GAME_GUIDE_Astrology_0: Astrology involves the study of constellations to gain knowledge that can greatly benefit you. By continuing to study these constellations, you can gain many permanent benefits that greatly increase your power across all aspects of the game.
GAME_GUIDE_Astrology_2: You gain Skill XP by studying various Constellations. These Constellations provide specific bonuses to Skills that are listed.
GAME_GUIDE_Astrology_3: As you increase your Mastery Level, you will unlock new Stars that can be upgraded to earn powerful bonuses.
GAME_GUIDE_Astrology_5: While studying, your character may spot falling stars from the sky. These will automatically grant you Stardust and Golden Stardust.
GAME_GUIDE_Astrology_6: These items can be used to upgrade stars within constellations, granting permanent incremental modifiers.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_0: Explore the Map of Melvor and uncover many hidden areas and secrets throughout your journey.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_10: Travelling comes at a cost of GP per Hex you travel across. The pathfinding algorithm for travelling will always choose the cheapest route possible.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_12: You have the option to enable "Auto Survey" which will automatically survey Hexes in a spiral formation starting at the Hex you select. The first 10 Hexes to be surveyed will be displayed.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_13: Auto Survey will continue surveying until you travel, manually stop it, or run out of Hexes to survey.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_14: Note: Auto Survey will ignore "Survey Range" as it continues to survey Hexes. In the event Auto Surveying is stopped, you must be within "Survey Range" of a Hex to begin surveying again.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_16: Undiscovered hexes with marked with a "!" denotes a "Dig Site" exists underneath.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_18: Undiscovered hexes with marked with a "?" denotes a "Point of Interest".
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_19: Discovering Dig Sites & Creating Maps for Archaeology
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_2: Surveying Hexes is the primary mechanic of Cartography which will allow you to slowly uncover the Map of Melvor and discover various locations that will help with Archaeology and Combat.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_20: Before you can train Archaeology, you must first locate Dig Sites within Cartography and then create Maps.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_22: Dig Sites are marked with a "!" on the undiscovered Hex. When you survey this Hex to maximum level, you will be able to create Maps for it - the primary requirement for excavating Dig Sites in Archaeology.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_24: Select the "Create Map" button at the top of Cartography to begin making Maps.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_25: First, you need to create Paper which is made out of any Log of your choosing.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_26: Next, select "Map Creation" create a Maps for the selected Dig Site. This will use Paper per action to increase the power of the Map.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_28: There are 4 tiers of Maps - Poor, Fine, Excellent and Perfect. While creating a Map, it will automatically upgrade to the next tier based on the amount of Upgrade Actions required.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_3: How to manually survey a Hex
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_30: The "Actions Remaining" listed on a Map determines the amount of uses it has within Archaeology until it disappears. A Map can have up to 20,000 actions.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_31: You are able to use a Map in Archaeology whenever you want, as long as it has actions remaining.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_33: This value determines your chance at obtaining an Artefact of that size from the Dig Site within Archaeology. The lower the number, the higher the chance of obtaining one.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_34: When upgrading a Map to the next tier, these numbers will reduce, providing you with a better chance per action to obtain the Artefact. These values stop decreasing once your Map reaches Perfect tier.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_36: Map Refinements are modifiers you can attach to your Maps to increase its power. These refinements also come at a cost per application.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_37: Higher tier Maps have more refinement slots to use.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_4: Select a Hex within your "Survey Range" and click "Survey". This will begin the action of surveying the Hex until it reaches maximum level.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_6: Survey Range determines what Hexes can be surveyed when beginning a survey action. You must be within Survey Range of a Hex to start surveying it. This is denoted by a light grey Hex.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_7: Sight Range act as your eyes of nearby Hexes, allowing you to see if anything is hiding beneath a Hex. This is denoted by a darker shade of grey.
GAME_GUIDE_CARTOGRAPHY_9: You are able to travel around the Map of Melvor on Hexes that have been fully surveyed.
GAME_GUIDE_COMBAT_COMBAT_AREAS_0: Standard Combat Areas. Start here on your Combat Journey.
GAME_GUIDE_COMBAT_COMBAT_AREAS_1: Large Variety of Monsters and Drops.
GAME_GUIDE_COMBAT_DUNGEONS_0: Fight through various types of Enemies to reach the final Boss. Slay the Boss to receive high value rewards.
GAME_GUIDE_COMBAT_SLAYER_AREAS_0: Killing Monsters here grants Slayer XP. Some Areas require Special Items or Slayer Level to access.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_0: Township is a Skill that is designed to passively progress in the background while you train in other areas of the game, and acts as a utility Skill to assist with your progression. It is not designed to be solely focused on.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_10: Keep this number high to store more resources over time.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_11: This will increase your Population, which in turn will increase the Skill XP you earn every Town Update.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_12: This will increase the amount of resources you generate within Township every Town Update.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_13: Your Town's current Population is modified by the Health percent. The lower this is, the lower your Population will become.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_14: At level 15 Township, there is a 25% chance Health will be reduced by 1% every Town update. This number cannot go below 20%.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_15: You can increase the Health value by spending Herbs or Potions within the Town menu.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_16: Displays information regarding your selected Worship, and the current progress to your next bonus.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_17: Hover over or tap this icon to see what bonuses your selected Worship provides.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_18: The main menu of the Skill which displays a breakdown of your current Town, and allows you to construct more buildings.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_19: Complete various Tasks to earn rewards both within Township and outside of the Skill.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_2: Your Town will update every 1 hour, even when you are Offline. When your Town updates, you will gain resources and Skill XP.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_20: Be sure to check this menu regularly for the Casual Tasks that appear every 5 hours.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_21: This is where you can convert your own raw resources from the Bank into Township to assist in progression.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_22: You are also able to convert resources from Township for rare and unique Consumables that will assist in the general game.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_23: The Trader requires a Trading Post to be constructed within your Town to access.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_24: Here you can manage your Township resources by setting resource caps, or remove resources that are taking up too much storage space.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_3: The amount of Skill XP you earn every update is based on your Town's Population.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_4: Offline Town Updates follow the same rules as regular Offline, which is capped at 24 hours.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_5: Township has Seasons which provide various bonuses and debuffs to the Skill depending on which one is currently active.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_6: Seasons always last 3 days, and you can view the Season rotation by selecting View Season Modifiers button.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_7: Some Worships have secret rare Seasons which can some times occur.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_8: This determines the amount of Skill XP you earn every Town update. Keep this high to progress faster in the Skill.
GAME_GUIDE_Township_9: Township requires its own resources to progress and construct Buildings. These resources are stored within Township itself, and the maximum amount is determined by your Storage amount.
GOLBIN_RAID_BTN_0_1: Fight for survival in this infinite dungeon.
GOLBIN_RAID_BTN_1_1: Begin your fight for survival and earn Raid Coins
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_0: The Golbin Raid is the first permanent minigame added to Melvor Idle. It will be built and expanded upon to create a fun distraction for those who want to take a break from the grind. This gamemode offers unique rewards exclusive to the minigame.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_1: This minigame is specifically designed to be fair for everyone, at any level of the game. There is no advantage to having high level stats or items in this.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_10: Everyone attacks twice as fast in the Raid.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_12: All Skills, including Combat, are placed into "Offline Mode" during a Raid. Once a Raid is finished, you will be rewarded with progress for the Skill.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_13: Running out of Runes or Ammo during Combat or selecting a weapon that isn't compatible with your existing Ammo will replace your weapon with a Bronze Scimitar.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_14: Auto Eat Tier II is active throughout the Raid.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_15: There is no Potions or passive Pet Bonuses.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_16: No Combat Skill XP is gained during the Raid.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_17: You are limited to only 1 Equipment Set, and 1 Equipped Food. Choose wisely.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_18: The Weapons and Gear you can select are gated behind Wave requirements. Check the selections screen for info.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_19: All Runes acquired during the Raid are stored. Check the My Runes page in Combat to see what you have.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_20: All Magic Spells are unlocked from the start.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_21: Combat Triangle Modifiers for Standard & Hardcore characters still apply here (Including no Hitpoints Regen for Hardcore).
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_22: This is a safe minigame. Hardcore Characters are safe if you die.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_23: The Raid is in its second stage of development. Refer to Development Plan above.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_3: Defeat infinite waves of Golbins, progressing in difficulty and Combat Level each wave.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_4: You start at Level 1 Combat Skill Levels (Hitpoints Level 10) which increases by 1 at the end of each wave.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_5: Start with only a Bronze Scimitar, 200 Bronze Arrows, 500 Air, Water, Earth, Fire & Mind Runes, and 10 Shrimp
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_6: At the end of each wave you can select the desired item you wish to equip, chosen at random.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_7: Get as far as you can with the best build possible.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_8: Visit the Raid Shop to purchase upgrades that will assist in the Raid.
GOLBIN_RAID_INFORMATION_9: Running or dying in the Raid will reward you with Raid Coins based on what Wave you got up to. You cannot earn Raid Coins prior to Wave 4.
GOLBIN_RAID_MODIFIER_CHOICE: You gain ${posCount} positive modifier(s) and ${negCount} negative modifier(s) at the start and every ${waveCount} waves.
GOLBIN_RAID_POPUP_15: Note: Selecting the same Food as currently Equipped increases its Quantity. Selecting different Food replaces its Quantity.
GOLBIN_RAID_POPUP_16: Note: Selecting new Ammo will not reset your Ammo count. It will simply add the respective Quantity.
GOLBIN_RAID_POPUP_18: This is your currently Equipped Food.
GOLBIN_RAID_POPUP_2: Make this count. You cannot come back to this screen.
GOLBIN_RAID_SECOND_PASSIVE: Golbins have a chance to have a second passive effect.
GOLBIN_RAID_STAT_MODIFIER: Golbins have ${mult}x Accuracy Rating, Maximum Hit and Evasion
GOLBIN_RAID_TRIANGLE_Hardcore: Uses the Hardcore/Adventure Mode Combat Triangle
GOLBIN_RAID_TRIANGLE_Standard: Uses the Standard Mode Combat Triangle
HARVESTING_CHANCE_FOR_ITEM: Chance for Item: ${chance}% (Increased with each Item Intensity checkpoint)
HAVRESTING_FAILED_ACTION: You failed to harvest a primary Item.

HEX_MASTERY_INFO: Hexes can now be surveyed again to master them. Mastering multiple hexes unlocks permanent bonuses and grants unique rewards.

INVALID_DAMAGE_TYPE_MSG_0: The Monster you are fighting is immune this Weapon's Damage Type.
INVALID_DAMAGE_TYPE_MSG_1: You cannot use this Weapon's Damage Type in the current Combat Area.
INVALID_PRAYER_BOOK_SELECTED: You can only use Prayers from the same Prayer Book.
ITEM_ALREADY_DONATED: Item already donated to the Museum
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abnormal_Log: This is 1000x better than a Normal Log.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Absorbing_Shield: Passive: When hit, lose 5% evasion ratings and gain +1% damage reduction, stacking up to 3 times (lasts until end of fight)
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Compost: Used in Farming for Abyssal Plots only. Provides +50% Harvest quantity to the Plot, but disables the possibility of receiving Seeds on harvest.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Crafting_Gloves: Until depleted: +4% Crafting Abyssal XP, -5% cost to produce items in Crafting for Abyssal Realm only, +5 additional quantity of Abyssal Consumables gained in Crafting (Cannot be doubled).
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Firemaking_Glov: Until depleted: +4% Firemaking Abyssal XP, +1 additional quantity of primary resource gained in Firemaking for Abyssal Realm only (cannot be doubled).
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Fletching_Glove: Until depleted: +4% Fletching Abyssal XP, -0.2s Fletching Skill Interval for Abyssal Realm only, -5% cost to produce items in Fletching for Abyssal Realm only.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Fletching_Scrol: +1 additional quantity of primary resource gained in Fletching for Abyssal Arrows, Abyssal Bolts and Abyssal Javelins only (Cannot be doubled) and -10% chance to preserve resources in Fletching.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Harvesting_Glov: Until depleted: +4% Harvesting Abyssal XP, -3% Harvesting Skill Interval, +1 intensity per action in Harvesting.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Herblore_Gloves: Until depleted: +4% Herblore Abyssal XP, -5% cost to produce items in Herblore Abyssal Realm only, +10% chance to receive a Random Tier of the same Potion in Herblore for Abyssal Realm only.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Mining_Gloves: Until depleted: +4% Mining Abyssal XP, -15% Mining node respawn interval for Abyssal Realm only, +40% chance to gain +1 additional resource in Mining for Abyssal Realm only (Cannot be doubled).
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Runecrafting_Gl: Until depleted: +4% Runecrafting Abyssal XP, -5% Runecrafting Skill Interval for Abyssal Realm only, +1 additional quantity of Abyssal Runes & Abyssal Combination Runes gained in Runecrafting (Cannot be doubled).
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Slayer_Upgrade_: Used to upgrade all tiers of Abyssal Slayer Gear.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Smithing_Gloves: Until depleted: +4% Smithing Abyssal XP, +50% chance to gain +1 additional resource in Smithing for Abyssal Bars (Cannot be doubled).
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Staff: Reduces the Abyss Rune cost of Magic Spells by 1 when equipped as a Weapon (Cost cannot go below 1).
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Wand: Reduces the Abyss Rune cost of Magic Spells by 1 when equipped as a Weapon (Cost cannot go below 1).
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_XP_Scroll_of_Ga: +3% Abyssal XP for Woodcutting, Fishing, Firemaking, Mining, Thieving, Agility, Astrology & Harvesting.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_XP_Scroll_of_Pr: +3% Abyssal XP for Cooking, Smithing, Fletching, Crafting, Runecrafting, Herblore & Summoning.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Accuracy_Gem: +3% Global Accuracy per Attack Turn, stacking up to 10 times (Stacks reset to 0 at maximum stacks)
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Adaptive_Accuracy_Potio: Accuracy Ratings are multiplied by 1.5 times current Hitpoints percent
Accuracy Ratings are multiplied by 1.5 times current Hitpoints percent
Accuracy Ratings are multiplied by 1.5 times current Hitpoints percent
Accuracy Ratings are multiplied by 1.5 times current Hitpoints percent
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Adaptive_Defence_Potion: Evasion Ratings are multiplied by 1.5 times current Hitpoints percent
Evasion Ratings are multiplied by 1.5 times current Hitpoints percent
Evasion Ratings are multiplied by 1.5 times current Hitpoints percent
Evasion Ratings are multiplied by 1.5 times current Hitpoints percent
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Agile_Gem: -0.8% Attack Interval per Attack Turn, stacking up to 12 times (Stacks reset to 0 at maximum stacks)
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Air_Battlestaff: Reduces the Air Rune cost of Magic Spells by 5 when equipped as a Weapon (Cost cannot go below 1).
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Air_Imbued_Wand: Reduces the Air Rune cost of Magic Spells by 3 when equipped as a Weapon (Cost cannot go below 1).
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Alchemic_Practice_Potio: +10% Chance to Double Items in Herblore
+15% Chance to Double Items in Herblore
+20% Chance to Double Items in Herblore
+25% Chance to Double Items in Herblore
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Alchemists_Bag: +10% Chance To Preserve Potion Charge and +5 Charges per Potion. One item is consumed when a Potion charge is used.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Alchemists_Bag_II: +15% Chance To Preserve Potion Charge and +8 Charges per Potion. One item is consumed when a Potion charge is used.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Amulet_Of_Incantation: -0.20s Alt. Magic Interval and +10% Rune Preservation for Alt. Magic Spells
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Amulet_of_Curse_Totem_S: When equipped with Gloves of Greater Shade Summon, Hood of Shade Summon and Ring of Phantom Summon: +30% Chance to preserve Summoning Charges and +200% Summoning Maximum Hit
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Ancient_Arcana: Enables the use of new Ancient Magic Spells while equipped.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Ancient_Brush: Used to purchase a Shop unlock.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Ancient_Ring_Of_Skills: Grants +8% Skill XP from non-Combat Skills when equipped, including Alt. Magic.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Ancient_Shovel: Used to purchase a Shop unlock.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Ancient_Sieve: Used to purchase a Shop unlock.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Ancient_Stone_Tablet: Grants access to Dark Quarry Slayer Area and Golem Territory Dungeon.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Ancient_Sword: If you have 100% Hitpoints, +20% Damage to All Monsters.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Ancient_Trowel: Used to purchase a Shop unlock.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Ancient_Wall_Chart: A chart detailing the location of the Shipwreck Cove Dig Site in Cartography. An icon has now appeared displaying its location. You can sell this item.
ITEM_DESCRIPTION_Ancient_Wizard_Boots: Passive: +5 Minimum Damage when using Air, Water, Earth or Fire Spells; +6% Accuracy Rating and Maximum Hit when using Surge Spells.

LOADING_SCREEN_NOTICE_0_HTML: By purchasing Melvor Idle on Steam, you can play on the official Mobile app at no additional cost by simply using a Melvor Cloud account.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_0_0: In the early stages of our world, everything existed as an energetic and shapeless mass with endless possibilities outstretched before it. All it needed was a pair of skilled hands to mold it into whatever they saw fit. It was here that The Four each tried, in turn, to harness their abilities to create something meaningful. An incalculable amount of time passed as the gods each tried and failed to produce anything that held longstanding merit.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_0_1: The Four were comprised of, Aeris, Glacia, Terran, and Ragnar, all of which attempted to rise up to the challenge to breathe life and creation into existence. To create something meaningful, and worth sharing with one another. However, despite all their efforts, individually, none of them were happy with what they were able to make. Frustrated with their individual lack of progress, they eventually pooled their power together and created the land known as Melvor.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_0_2: The Four frequently consulted one another, asking for input, sharing in successes, and propping one another up during their failures. Everything was harmonious in the beginning, with contributions from all being considered and given equal weight. This went incredibly well, until the creation of... us. The Vorlorans that inhabit this world. The Four were incredibly divided on how to properly lead, guide, and nurture us, and despite having no major disagreements ever before, this was simply too dire for them to move past amicably. The Gods fell into disarray, frequently quarreling with one another over status, power, and how to lead us...
LORE_PARAGRAPH_0_3: As The Four splintered, our world did as well, and war was raged across its entirety, egged on by the Gods who refused to see past their differences. Blinded by their growing hatred for one another, none saw the scheme of Malcs, leader of the lesser dragons. With a huge toll of lives and power, the Four were sealed away and held in place by Malcs' soul, who became revered in the eyes of Melvor's populace for such a feat. Without the Four's interference or any reason to remain fighting, the once brutal and fiery war died off nearly overnight.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_0_4: After draining himself of so much power, Malcs entered a self-imposed exile to regain his strength and guard himself against those who may wish to destroy him in his weakened state. Many years passed by as Malcs bound himself to his new home. The tales of his riches and power never ceased though, and many sought after his location. Nothing stays hidden forever, not even the leader of the lesser dragons. Malcs defended himself for years, trying to keep the Four he bound to his soul contained... until it was broken.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_0_5: As his body shattered, the Four were set free once again. Four pillars of light streamed forth, darting into the sky:
LORE_PARAGRAPH_0_6: Aeris, the God of Air's Radiant Silver. Glacia, the God of Water's Soft Blue. Terran, the God of Earth's Mossy Green. And Ragnar, the God of Fire's Burning Red.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_0_7: All four found an endpoint within Melvor, and at the end of these beams of light rose dungeons that rivaled the largest and most opulent kingdoms in both size and majesty. Bitter over their imprisonment, their temper's flare once again and the Gods raise armies to tear one another apart. With you at the center, what do you aim to do with what you've wrought out upon the land?
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_0: You set out early in the morning, without saying goodbye to the family youre staying with. You trust that they will care for Ahrenia until she wakes  if she ever does.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_1: The jungle is as hot and as deadly as Ahrenia told you it would be. It is completely silent. No birds sing, no monkeys chatter  you dont see so much as a mosquito. As you hack your way through the thick vines, you feel an odd prickle on the back of your neck, as though something really is watching you  something malevolent, and hungry.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_10: The fourth monster is the toughest one of all. Its an enormous snake that winds through the corridors of the labyrinth, venom dripping from its monstrous fangs. You have to watch your step as you battle, constantly dodging its strikes, letting it tire itself out before you close the distance to fight back. At long last, it falls.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_11: Exhausted, you make your way to the nearest rest point. After each monster fell, a brightly coloured path appeared on the map, and this one should be no different. There! A river of golden ink bubbles up and, as if by magic, crawls a trail towards the Ancient Sanctuary. Youve done it!
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_12: With no time to spare, you rush through the labyrinth. Right, left, right again, over a crumbling wall, through a tunnel, and left one more time  there it is! Before you stands a humble, unassuming stone building. Above the entrance, five enormous gems glow  one for each monster you defeated.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_13: With a sigh of relief, you stroll towards the Sanctuary door. Soon youll have the clues you need to find The Herald, and then you can start a new adventure.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_14: Youre so caught up in your imaginings that you fail to notice the vine slowly wrapping around your leg until it pulls, sharply, and hoists you up in the air. You yell in surprise as the world turns upside down.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_15: The vine snaps, whip-like, and hurls you into the Sanctuary wall with a crash. You get to your feet, clutching your head, and see an enormous, humanoid figure sprout up out of the ground. Her hair is a crown of bright red thorns stretching all down her back. Her legs end in titanic roots, and her body is covered in writhing vines as thick as your chest.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_16: Champion! the Guardian of the Sanctuary calls out to you in a voice that shakes the very walls around you. I am Morellia, Guardian of the Sanctuary. None may enter here!
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_17: I am chosen! you reply, trying your best to stay upright. By Ahrenia!
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_18: Morellia pauses, vines circling lazily through the air.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_19: Then you must prove that you are worthy. Are you prepared for battle?
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_2: Nevertheless, you make your way through the thick foliage unimpeded. It seems that Ahrenias power has made you worthy after all.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_20: You look down at yourself  covered in venomous spines and bits of plant matter, armour ripped to shreds not to mention your boots, covered in the visceral remains of the giant snake. You sigh. Its not like youre getting any readier.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_21: Im prepared, you yell. Lets do this!
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_3: After many long hours, you find your path blocked by a high sandstone wall. This must be the labyrinth. You reach out, intending to climb the vines growing along the wall, but as your hand makes contact with the stone you feel an odd sensation  as though the wall isnt there at all. Cautiously, you push forward, and fall through the wall onto a neatly tiled stone floor.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_4: You pick yourself up and look around. Youre in a labyrinth alright, in some sort of rest stop. A grisly-looking skeleton in the corner tells the tale of the last unfortunate soul to find their way here. Hopefully, youre better prepared.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_5: Before you sits a large stone carving. Surprisingly, it looks to be some sort of map. A special perk for the chosen one, perhaps?
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_6: The carving shows a birds-eye view of the labyrinth, with a large, square building in the centre. That must be the sanctuary. Assuming the top is north, you trace your finger around the side to try and pinpoint where you entered from  and as you do so, you notice that the labyrinth is full of dead ends, trails that go back on each other, and even hidden passages. Hm. Thats going to be a problem.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_7: You turn your attention instead to four figures dotted haphazardly around the map. They are all manner of shapes and sizes, but their colours instantly attract your attention: silver, blue, green, and red. The colours of the gods!
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_8: A loud, roaring croak rings out, startling you away from the map. It came from just around the corner - that must be monster number one! You check over your weapons and start moving towards it, sparing a last glance at the unfortunate skeleton as you pass. If you dont want to end up like them, youd better get moving
LORE_PARAGRAPH_10_9: After so many weeks holed up and hiding from The Heralds minions, the rush of battle is a surprisingly welcome break. You dispatch the first monster, a large, squat toad, with ease, using a well-timed barrage of Water Strikes. The second one, some kind of flying lizard, is a little tougher until you realise you can use your bow and arrows to knock it out of the sky. The third one is absolutely monstrous, a plant the size of a house that kept trying to turn you into fertilizer.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_11_1: The Guardian of the Sanctuary holds out one enormous hand, covered in greenery. You stop slicing at the vine constricting your leg as it withdraws back into the ground.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_11_10: You move closer. A large and powerful figure. Imposing of stance and commanding of eye. But theres more.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_11_11: Its eyes are two purple gems.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_11_12: You look back at the other carvings. Smaller figures, worshippers  are these the people of the Gods? Is this Sanctuary theirs?
LORE_PARAGRAPH_11_13: It all makes sense now  the sense of great power emanating from the place. Did they use this power, was this its source? Or did they grant it with their power, and were their worshippers harnessing it for their own world-altering purposes? What happened to them all?
LORE_PARAGRAPH_11_14: There is an almost-hidden alcove to the west of the hall. You breathe in deeply and slide through a gap between crumbled walls. Bursting through, you stumble over an enormous frame. Leaning it against a stone pillar, you dust it down and fix it with a studying eye.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_11_15: It seems to depict the sanctuary itself, not in the lush green of its current overgrown state, but in blotches of blood red and steely grey. A battle  or perhaps the battle was already won, and this is the aftermath. Bodies everywhere  some weeping and running. Most of them are crumpled and lifeless. You back away from the visceral horror of it, stumbling over relics and sending a rusted chalice rolling across the floor. You push back through the gap and stagger into the main hall  dizzy, you look up to the eastern wall. Suddenly, you see it in full.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_11_16: The sheer size of the carving meant its meaning eluded you when you first entered, but now you can see all of it  huge stretched out wings reach to each end of the hall, framing terrifying claws and a gigantic, malevolent head, filled with teeth. Its an enormous dragon. Streaks of lightning are depicted in great electric slashes, and in the distance, a tower.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_11_17: Not just any tower  the Millennium Tower. Perhaps this carving is a clue to its location. You step back and scan the far walls of the Sanctuary. A broader picture begins to form. The tower seems to be protected by the great dragon, which resides in a place blasted by storms. LORE_PARAGRAPH_16_17: You explain everything  the Dark Mist, Bane, your quest to find The Herald before they strike again. The Necromancer watches, expressionless.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_16_18: I was told you were imprisoned by a terrible curse, and that lifting it will reveal the path to The Herald, you finish.
LORE_PARAGRAPH_16_19: I am indeed cursed, the Necromancer intones,   and so too, are you. This land is shrouded in darkness, an attempt to prevent interlopers from discovering the art of Summoning and using it for their own ends.

What youd taken to be an odd dent on the front of the rock is a deliberately carved niche, and whats more, the shape looks surprisingly familiar.

The light dims, and when you look back the dais has moved backwards to reveal a spiral staircase leading deep underground. You take a deep breath. Could this be the Necromancers lair?

LORE_PARAGRAPH_1_0: Radiant Silver, wings of bountiful colors. Aeris is known as the Loving God. Given the power of flight she travelled the world radiating her love and beauty towards all the populace of Melvor. In the eyes of the people she was a beacon of hope and a symbol of peace in which the gods upheld. When trouble arose she would always be there as if a guardian was always watching over. During the early times she would often meet with the other gods to discuss the role she would play, however she considered only one a good friend. Over the many years that had passed her tireless effort had left her exhausted. "It's always the same." she cried. With all her effort she truly believed she was doing good. But the world is cruel and ever changing. Was she really ever needed? she thought. Upset and no longer wanting to feel this way she decides to exact the opposite of what she stood for. And so in the end the once loving god of Melvor becomes the recluse. Leaving the people to fend for themselves. "I wonder, what does all this power amount to when its no longer there, what do the people do when the hero leaves?"
LORE_PARAGRAPH_2_0: Soft Blue, a cold heart. Glacia is known as the Helping God. While managing the oceans and seas she would guide lost voyagers who had gone astray to safety. The explorers of Melvor called her the Ocean's Spirit, for when she was happy the oceans were calm and when she was not the waves echoed it. The role she played was not something she wanted to do, but she knew it was her duty to maintain. Her true dream was to be free above the clouds like Aeris. Being tied to the oceans it was the only thing that was ever on her mind. However the burden of not being able to lied deep within her heart. Despite knowing she was shackled she would still try time and time again but fail. To always see Aeris soar away after their meeting was enough to break her. And as time went by her growing bitterness towards her role eventually escalated to hatred when Aeris decided she would no longer fulfil her role anymore. Having clung to this dream for so long and seeing someone squander it was outrageous to her. And so they argued and argued for even longer until only what was left was nothing but pain behind her eyes. And after all these years it had already consumed her inner self. "Do you pity those who use their power for everyone else knowing they can never help themselves? they are the ones who tread the line between a blessing and curse."
LORE_PARAGRAPH_3_0: Mossy Green, careless wisdom. Terran is known as the Entrusted god. The Earth God was the first before the others. With his power he transformed most of the worlds landmass to how it is seen today. All but one of the other gods respected him as their elder, knowing full well he would be the most knowledgeable. And so being unrestricted he was allowed to do whatever he wanted. The early inhabitants of Melvor saw him as the greatest of all which gave him all the support he needed to further continue his work. Terran would also organize the meetings of gods and instruct them of the role they should be upholding. But since the other gods never questioned him his ignorance towards everyone grew in parallel with his arrogance. As time went by to him there were no more boundaries, which in turn led to the anger of the other gods. But it had been so long, he did so much so what was different for him now? And so in his mind he was so sure he was betrayed when he was confined to a place where he no longer had any influence. "Solitary, confined to my own darkness. The whispers of a thousand cries brush over me like the wind. Is this true torture? Maybe not. This is the beginning of a new true king."
LORE_PARAGRAPH_4_0: Burning Red, a demonic ego. Ragnar is known as the Chaotic god. The Fire God was the youngest of all the gods. With the power of fire he stood above the rest in terms of strength and he knew. His fierce rivalries with the other gods and his lack of emotion towards everyone else was troublesome. Knowing this the other gods shunned him and for the benefit of all living creatures he was restrained to a lesser influence by Terran. Ragnar was treated like an outcast and for a god to be shackled to this kind of level was demeaning. Ragnar despised Terran but he also knew he was not yet strong enough to take on all three of them and so he decides to start scheming in the background. Through his subordinates he would start to spread rumors which led to hate and violence amongst the people. His targeted actions were ruthless and lingered for years. Knowing full well who would eventually be blamed for this, Terran. And so with the growing hostilities between the gods and the inevitability of war on the horizon the restraints that once held him back turned feeble. The others will remember why he was known as the strongest. "Patience is the key to everything, the weak seek to find their opportunity while the strong know when it is their time again."
