SETTINGS_RESET_99_MSG_0: This will reset all Skill levels to 99 (1 XP from level 100). Use this if you want to experience the expansion as it was intended to be played.
SETTINGS_RESET_99_MSG_1: Once reset, this cannot be undone.
SETTINGS_RESET_99_MSG_2: Note: This will only reset Skills that have an XP value greater than or equal to 14,391,160 (Level 100 XP).
SETTINGS_RESET_99_SWAL_BODY_0: This will reset all Skill levels to 99 (1 XP from level 100). Use this if you want to experience the expansion as it was intended to be played.
SETTINGS_RESET_99_SWAL_BODY_1: The game will automatically refresh when confirming.
SETTINGS_SETTING_0_3:
Determines the colours used for Enemy Special Attack Modifier descriptions.
Colours are determined by the game's general perspective of a Buff / Debuff.
SETTINGS_SETTING_1_0: Toggle Ignore Bank Full - Skills will continue to train and use resources even when your Bank becomes full. This will result in items being destroyed if they cannot fit in your Bank.
SETTINGS_SETTING_1_5: Reduce CPU & GPU usage by pausing actions for all skills when the game is minimised or placed in the background to activate offline progression upon return.
SETTINGS_SETTING_2_10: Show confirmation when attempting to reroll a 5% Astrology Modifier.
SETTINGS_SETTING_2_11: Show current quantity of item in your Bank in Item Notification.
SETTINGS_SETTING_2_5: Show "You have been Stunned" Notifications in Combat.
SETTINGS_SETTING_2_6: Show "You are now Asleep" Notifications in Combat.
SETTINGS_SETTING_2_7: Show Notification when you discover a Summoning Mark (Level up popups will always show).
SETTINGS_SETTING_2_8: Show confirmation when attempting to close the game.
SETTINGS_SETTING_2_9: Show confirmation when attempting to destroy a Farming crop.
SETTINGS_SETTING_3_0: Toggle Offline Time Cap Push Notifications
SETTINGS_SETTING_3_1: Toggle Farming "Ready to Harvest" Push Notifications
SETTINGS_SETTING_3_2: Connect Mobile Device to your Cloud Account
SETTINGS_SETTING_3_3:
If you are logged into the Cloud, this allows the Desktop versions of the game to schedule Push Notifications to your Mobile Device.
If you are having issues, or have changed Devices, please disconnect and then reconnect your Device.
SETTINGS_SETTING_4_2: Display Combat Minibar on Combat Screen
SETTINGS_SETTING_4_3: Combat Minibar - Display Equipment Set Selection
SETTINGS_SETTING_4_4: Combat Minibar - Display Enemy Hitpoints & Attack Bar
SETTINGS_SETTING_5_6: (REQUIRES REFRESH FOR CHANGES TO TAKE EFFECT).
SETTINGS_SETTING_5_7: Toggle Minor Accessibility Features. Please refresh after changing setting.
SETTINGS_SETTING_MISC_0: Automatically equip food when it is made?
SETTINGS_SHOW_COMBAT_AREA_WARNINGS: Toggle warning messages for Combat Areas
SETTINGS_SHOW_EXPANSION_BACKGROUND_COLOU: Toggle background colours for Expansion Combat Areas
SETTINGS_THROTTLE_FRAME_RATE: Throttle Cartography Map Frame Rate on Inactivity
SETTINGS_THROTTLE_FRAME_RATE_DESC: Frame rate will be capped to 10 FPS after 5 minutes of inactivity.
SETTINGS_TOGGLE_EYEBLEACH: Toggle Eyebleach Mode for Lair of the Spider Queen Dungeon.
SETTINGS_alwaysShowRealmSelectAgility: Always show Legacy Realm Selection in Agility.
SETTINGS_bankFilterShowAbyssalDamage: Show Abyssal Damage Weapons
SETTINGS_bankFilterShowAbyssalResistance: Show Equipment with Abyssal Resistance
SETTINGS_bankFilterShowAbyssalXP: Items that modify Abyssal XP
SETTINGS_bankFilterShowDamageReduction: Show Equipment with Damage Reduction
SETTINGS_bankFilterShowNormalDamage: Show Normal Damage Weapons
SETTINGS_bankFilterShowSkillXP: Items that modify Skill XP
SETTINGS_enableDoubleClickBury: Toggle Double Click to Bury Items
SETTINGS_enableDoubleClickEquip: Toggle Double Click to Equip Items
SETTINGS_enableDoubleClickOpen: Toggle Double Click to Open Items

Automatically Corrupt Monsters on Spawn?

SETTINGS_showAPNextToShopSidebar: Show Abyssal Pieces in the Sidebar instead of GP
SETTINGS_showASCNextToSlayerSidebar: Show Abyssal Slayer Coins in the Sidebar instead of Slayer Coins
SETTINGS_showOpacityForSkillNavs: Set Skill in Sidebar to slightly transparent if there is no content for the current Realm (New Realm select only).
SETTINGS_showSPNextToPrayerSidebar: Show Soul Points in the sidebar instead of Prayer Points
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_Abyssal_Resupply: +${qty1} Abyssium Arrows, +${qty2} Nightopal Bolts, +${qty3} Ire Runes, +${qty4} Crimson Bream (Perfect), +${qty5} Weak Souls
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_Adamant_Axe: -5% Woodcutting Cut Interval for a total of -25% applied from your Axe.
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_Adamant_Fishing_Rod: -5% Fishing Interval for a total of -25% applied from your Fishing Rod.
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_Adamant_Pickaxe: -10% Mining Interval for a total of -30% applied from your Pickaxe. +1% chance to double ores per action for a total of +5% from your Pickaxe.
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_AmmoBonus: +5% to Maximum Ranged Ammo Qty possible.
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_Augite_Axe: +3% Chance for Bird Nests to drop in Woodcutting and +3% Chance to Double Items in Woodcutting
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_Augite_Fishing_Rod: +20% chance to receive +1 Fish in Fishing (Cannot be doubled) and +1% chance to find a Lost Chest while Fishing (This is separate to the Special Fishing Chance)
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_Augite_Pickaxe: +20% Chance to receive +1 item while Mining an "Ore" Node (Cannot be doubled)
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_AutoEquipFood: Automatically equip Food that is Actively Cooked if that Food is already equipped or an empty Food slot is available. This can be toggled on or off.
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_AutoSwapFood: When running out of Food in Combat, automatically swap to a different Food Slot that contains food. This can be toggled on or off.
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_Auto_Eat_Tier_I: Using your current equipped food only, automatically consume the food to fill your Hitpoints to at least 40% when it is equal to or below 20% Hitpoints. Food Efficiency: 60% (Food heals for 60% of the value shown when Auto Eating).
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_Auto_Eat_Tier_II: Using your current equipped food only, automatically consume the food to fill your Hitpoints to at least 60% when it is equal to or below 30% Hitpoints. Food Efficiency: 80% (Food heals for 80% of the value shown when Auto Eating).
SHOP_DESCRIPTION_Auto_Eat_Tier_III: Using your current equipped food only, automatically consume the food to fill your Hitpoints to at least 80% when it is equal to or below 40% Hitpoints. Food Efficiency: 100% (Food heals for 100% of the value shown when Auto Eating).

SKIP_CLOUD_AUTHENTICATION_MSG:
A Cloud account allows you to continue your progress on any platform Melvor Idle is available on.
Skipping means your saves will be stored locally on your device and will not be backed up to the Cloud.
Local saves cannot be restored if lost.
SLAYER_AREA_EFFECT_AfflictedCity: Enemy has +${effectValue}% to apply Decay Curse per hit
SLAYER_AREA_EFFECT_High_Lands: Enemies heal ${effectValue}% of their current hitpoints every 5 turns
SLAYER_AREA_EFFECT_JungleLabyrinth: If Player is poisoned, Enemies have ${effectValue}% chance to apply deadly poison per attack
SLAYER_AREA_EFFECT_LavaLake: ${effectValue}% of your Current HP is taken as damage per Attack
SLAYER_AREA_EFFECT_MidnightValley: Enemy gains up to +${effectValue}% Global Evasion Rating every 2 turns (Lasts 2 turns)
SLAYER_AREA_EFFECT_ParanoiaPit: +${effectValue}% of Current Hitpoints taken as damage per missed attack (once per turn)
SLAYER_AREA_EFFECT_Runic_Ruins: -${effectValue}% Magic Evasion if your Attack Style is not Magic
SLAYER_AREA_EFFECT_ToxicSwamps: Enemies have +${effectValue}% chance to apply poison when attacking
SLAYER_AREA_EFFECT_ToxicWastes: Enemies have +${effectValue}% Toxin Lifesteal and +${effectValue}% chance to apply Toxin when attacking
SLAYER_AREA_EFFECT_UnhallowedWasteland: Enemies heal ${effectValue}% of their current hitpoints every 2 turns
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AberrationBite: Perform an avoidable attack that deals ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of the enemy's max hit. Heals the enemy for ${lifesteal}% of the damage dealt.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AbyssalBarrage: An avoidable attack that deals ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of the enemy's normal damage ${hitCount} times over ${duration}s. Gives the enemy -${preHitEffect0modValue0}% Attack Interval for ${preHitEffect0turns} of the enemy's turns.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AbyssalCrash: An avoidable attack that deals ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of the enemy's max hit as damage. On a hit, gives you -${onHitEffect0modValue0}% Maximum Hit for ${onHitEffect0turns} of your turns.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AbyssalDoubleShot: An avoidable attack that deals ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of your normal damage ${hitCount} times over ${duration}s. On a hit, gives the enemy -${onHitEffect0modValue0}% Maximum Hit for ${onHitEffect0turns} of the enemy's turns.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AbyssalDoubleStrike: An avoidable attack that deals ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of your normal damage ${hitCount} times over ${duration}s. On a hit, gives the enemy -${onHitEffect0modValue0}% Maximum Hit for ${onHitEffect0turns} of the enemy's turns.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AbyssalIncantation: An avoidable attack that deals ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of your normal damage. On a hit, gives the enemy -${onHitEffect0modValue0}% Maximum Hit for ${onHitEffect0turns} of the enemy's turns.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AbyssalParry: Perform a regular attack. Gives the enemy +${preHitEffect0modValue0}% ${preHitEffect0modResistanceName0} and +${preHitEffect0modValue1}% Global Evasion for ${preHitEffect0turns} of your turns.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AbyssalToss: An avoidable attack that deals ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of the enemy's normal damage ${hitCount} times over ${duration}s. On a hit, applies stun for ${onHitEffect0turns} turn.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AbyssalWhirlwind: An avoidable attack that deals ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of the enemy's normal damage ${hitCount} times over ${duration}s. On a hit, inflicts a stack of Laceration. Laceration deals damage equal to ${onHitEffect0percent}% of the enemy's max hit per stack (Stacks up to ${onHitEffect0maxStacks} times) every ${onHitEffect0interval}s.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AcidicBlast: An avoidable attack that deals ${attackDamageMaxValue0} damage ${hitCount} times over ${duration}s. On a hit, gives you -${onHitEffect0modValue0}% Damage Reduction that stacks up to ${onHitEffect0maxStacks} times.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AggressiveOnslaught: The enemy rages and wildly swings at you dealing ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of the enemy's normal damage ${hitCount} times over ${duration}s. Avoidable.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AgileHunter: Gives the enemy -${preHitEffect0modValue0}% Attack Interval and +${preHitEffect0modValue1}% Global Evasion for ${preHitEffect0turns} of the enemy's turns.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AgileWings: The enemy aims at weak points and unleashes a powerful combination attack, performing ${hitCount} avoidable strikes that deal ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of the enemy's normal damage on the 1st attack, ${attackDamageMaxValue1}% of the enemy's normal damage on the 2nd attack, and ${attackDamageMaxValue2}% of the enemy's normal damage on the 3rd attack. On a hit, has a ${onHitEffect0chance}% chance to inflict Bleed that deals ${onHitEffect0DamageMaxValue0}% of the damage dealt as damage over ${onHitEffect0duration}s.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AgileWingsPlayer: You aim at weak points and unleash a powerful combination attack, performing ${hitCount} avoidable strikes that deal ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of your normal damage on the 1st attack, ${attackDamageMaxValue1}% of your normal damage on the 2nd attack, and ${attackDamageMaxValue2}% of your normal damage on the 3rd attack. On a hit, has a ${onHitEffect0chance}% chance to inflict Bleed that deals ${onHitEffect0DamageMaxValue0}% of the damage dealt as damage over ${onHitEffect0duration}s.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_Agility: An avoidable attack that deals ${attackDamageMaxValue0} damage. Gives the enemy -${preHitEffect0modValue0}% Attack Interval for ${preHitEffect0turns} of the enemy's turns.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_Alacrity: The Herald casts a spell dealing ${attackDamageMaxValue0} damage ${hitCount} times over ${duration}s. On a hit, gives the enemy -${onHitEffect0modValue0}% Attack Interval for ${onHitEffect0turns} of the enemy's turns. Avoidable.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_Allure: The enemy sings a calming song that deals no damage. On a hit, applies sleep for ${onHitEffect0turns} turns. Avoidable. If you are already sleeping, the enemy performs a regular attack instead.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AngryGrudge: The enemy performs a regular attack. They creak and groan, invoking the unholy prayer of Grudge, giving them +${preHitEffect0modValue0}% of Maximum Hit added to Minimum Hit for ${preHitEffect0turns} of the enemy's turns and giving you -${preHitEffect1modValue0}% Global Evasion for ${preHitEffect1turns} of the enemy's turns.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_Anguish: Fires quick beams from all eyes, ${attackDamageMaxValue0} ${hitCount} times over ${duration}s. On a hit, Applies +${onHitEffect0stacks} stack of Spinning Axe to you (Maximum ${onHitEffect0maxStacks} stacks). Spinning Axe gives -${onHitEffect0modValue0}% Global Accuracy per stack. One stack is removed after each of your turns. Avoidable.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_AugiteCrystallization: <Attack> perform ${hitCount} attacks that deal ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of your normal damage over ${duration}s. On use, gives you +${preHitEffect0modValue0}% of Maximum Hit added to Minimum Hit for ${preHitEffect0turns} of your turns. Unavoidable.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_BadThrow: You throw out the grappling hook and miss, hooking a rock instead of the enemy. Deals no damage.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_Barrage: Perform ${hitCount} fast unavoidable attacks that deal ${attackDamageMaxValue0} damage each.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_BarragePlayer: (RANGED ONLY) Perform an attack dealing ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of your normal damage. Gain -${onHitEffect0modValue0}s Attack Interval,-${onHitEffect0modValue1}% Global Accuracy and -${onHitEffect0modValue2}% Maximum Hit each time you succesfully hit, stacking up to ${onHitEffect0maxStacks} times (Stacks reset on a miss)
SPECIAL_ATTACK_Battlecry: On use, gives the enemy +${preHitEffect0modValue0}% Damage Reduction and -${preHitEffect1modValue0}% Attack Interval for ${preHitEffect1turns} of the enemy's turns. Deals no damage. If the buff is already active, the enemy performs a regular attack instead.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_Bind: An avoidable attack that deals ${attackDamageMaxValue0} damage. On a hit, gives you +${onHitEffect0modValue0}% Attack Interval for ${onHitEffect0turns} of your turns.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_BlackHole: An avoidable attack that deals damage equal to ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of your max hit ${hitCount} times over ${duration}s. On a hit, has a ${onHitEffect0chance}% chance to inflict ${onHitEffect0stacks} stack of Voidburst, inflicts a Slow that gives the enemy +${onHitEffect1magnitude}% Attack Interval for ${onHitEffect1turns} of the enemy's turns and gives the enemy -${onHitEffect2modValue0}% ${onHitEffect2modResistanceName0} for ${onHitEffect2turns} of your turns.
SPECIAL_ATTACK_BladeEchoes: (MELEE ONLY) Perform 3 attacks that deal ${attackDamageMaxValue0}% of your normal damage on the 1st attack, ${attackDamageMaxValue1}% of your normal damage on the 2nd attack and ${attackDamageMaxValue2}% of your normal damage on the 3rd attack.

TOWNSHIP_BUILDINGS_REQUIRED_TO_DO_THAT: You must build ${count} more ${buildingName} to do that!
TOWNSHIP_CANNOT_WIN_NOTIFICATION: You don't have enough Armour & Weaponry to fight the Abyssal Wave
TOWNSHIP_DO_NOT_MEET_REQUIREMENTS: You don't meet the requirements to build that.
TOWNSHIP_FORTIFICATION_TOOLTIP_2: Final value of Fortification is also affected by your Town's Health
TOWNSHIP_MENU_AVAILABLE_OFFLINE_TIME: You have ${localTime} worth of Offline time available to spend.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_BUILDING_NOTIFY_0: Only buildings that can be built in the selected Biome are shown.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CANNOT_CHANGE_WORSHIP_SEAS: You cannot change Worships during this Season.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CANNOT_SKIP_TRADER: You don't have enough ticks to skip to their next arrival.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CAN_BUY_COOL_ROCKS: Allows the purchase of Cool Rocks from the Shop.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CAN_BUY_MALCS_CATS: Allows the purchase of Malcs' Cats from the Shop.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CAN_BUY_PRATS_HATS: Allows the purchase of Prat's Hats from the Shop.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CHANGE_WORSHIP: Are you sure you want to change your Worship?
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CHANGE_WORSHIP_DESC_0: Changing your Worship will cause a riot within your Town. This means:
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CHANGE_WORSHIP_DESC_1: All buildings that provide Worship will be destroyed.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CHANGE_WORSHIP_DESC_2: All building efficiency will drop by -50%
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CHANGE_WORSHIP_DESC_3: 50% of your Town buildings will be destroyed, picked at random (Except Storage buildings).
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CITIZENS_OLD_AGE_NOTICE: Citizens that die naturally at 100 years old decay instantly. They are not added to dead storage.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CITIZENS_OLD_AGE_NOTICE_GP: Citizens over the age of 70 provide 2x more GP.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CITIZENS_WORKER_AGE_NOTICE: Citizens can only work between the ages of 8 and 70 (inclusive).
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CLICK_WORKER_PRIORITY: Click to toggle Worker prioritisation for this resource.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_CONVERT_INFO: As you discover more items from various Skills in the game, they will then become available for conversion here.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_Desert_NOTIFY_0: Each building inside Desert Biome requires ${qty} Clothing per tick.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_Desert_NOTIFY_1: Without Clothing, large Happiness and Health penalties will apply.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_Desert_NOTIFY_2: You have no Clothing for your buildings inside the Desert Biome! Penalties to Happiness and Health have been applied.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_HAPPINESS_DEBUFF_DESC:
Possible Happiness Debuffs:
No Clothing for buildings in Desert: -50% Happiness
No Potions for Citizens over 55: -40% Happiness
Unemployed Citizens: -5 Happiness per Unemployed
Overflowing Dead Storage: -5 Happiness per dead citizen over max dead storage
TOWNSHIP_MENU_HEALTH_DESC_0: Town Population is modified by Health percent.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_HEALTH_DESC_1: At level 15 Township, Health will be reduced by 1% every Town update. Health does not go below 20%.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_HEALTH_DESC_2: Spend Herbs or Potions to increase Health by using the designated buttons in your Town.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_HEALTH_DESC_4: Total Potions and production per tick
TOWNSHIP_MENU_HEALTH_DESC_5: Total Clothing and production per tick
TOWNSHIP_MENU_HEALTH_DESC_6: Total Herbs and production per tick
TOWNSHIP_MENU_LOCKED_WORSHIP_NOTICE: Defeat the respective Boss to unlock locked Worships.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_MAX_BIOME_PURCHASED: Max amount of this biome already purchased.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NAME_TOWN: Choose a name for your Town:
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NOTICE_0: You don't have the population required to build a Tier ${number} building.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NOTICE_1: You cannot afford to build that.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NOTICE_11: Not enough resources in your Town to convert.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NOTICE_12: You don't have the Skill Level required to build a Tier ${number} building.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NOTICE_13: You lack the required resources to maintain buildings in this Biome.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NOTICE_2: Original building in selected biome not found!
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NOTICE_4: There is no available Biome Space for that.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NOTICE_6: Could not find this building in the selected Biome.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NOTICE_7: You cannot afford to buy another section!
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NOTICE_8: Not enough storage available to convert resources.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_NOTICE_9: Not enough resources in your Bank to convert.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_RESET_CONFIRM_0: Are you sure you want to reset your Town?
TOWNSHIP_MENU_REWORK_NOTIFICATION_1: Your old Town has been automatically converted to the new format based on your Township Skill Level (Except for the Town Hall).
TOWNSHIP_MENU_REWORK_NOTIFICATION_2: Saved Ticks have also been converted to the equivalent time saved. You can spend this time until it reaches 0. However, it is no longer possible gain ticks to spend.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_REWORK_NOTIFICATION_3: You have been refunded the difference in GP spent - ${value} GP
TOWNSHIP_MENU_SEASON_MULTIPLIER: All positive Worship modifiers are increased by ${value}x during ${seasonName}
TOWNSHIP_MENU_SETTINGS_DELETE_BUILDINGS_: This will delete all buildings within your Town.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_SETTINGS_RESTART_TOWN_desc: Completely reset your Town. Reload required.
You will lose all buildings and resources.
You keep your offline ticks to spend, and all Skill XP. The land you already purchased is also Free if you reset.
This option is ideal if you want to change your Worship or Map.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_SKIP_TO_TRADER: Would you like to claim ticks and skip to their arrival?
TOWNSHIP_MENU_Snowlands_NOTIFY_0: Each building inside Snowlands Biome requires ${qty} Coal per tick to function.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_Snowlands_NOTIFY_1: Without Coal, buildings inside Snowlands Biome will slow Resource Production and Benefits by 75%. This includes Resources, Education, Happiness and Worship.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_Snowlands_NOTIFY_2: You have no Coal! Buildings inside Snowlands Biome are only functioning at 25%. This includes Resources, Education, Happiness and Worship.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_TICKS_UNTIL_DECAY: ${qty} ticks until next decay. This will remove dead citizens equal to 1% (${amount}) of your maximum dead storage.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_TICK_DESC_0: Population and Worker assignment changes occur each tick.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_TICK_GAIN_MSG: You gain 1 tick every 1 hour, even when offline.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_TOWN_NO_FOOD_MSG_0: You have no Food! Citizens have a very high chance to die, and no new Citizens will move in until you have Food.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_TOWN_NO_FOOD_MSG_1: Your Food production is in the negatives! Build more Farmlands or Fishing Docks before you run out.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_TOWN_NO_PRIORITY: You aren't prioritising any resources! We suggest you always prioritise Food. This can be done by clicking the resource above (And make sure it is highlighted Green).
TOWNSHIP_MENU_TOWN_NO_STORAGE_0: You have no Storage space available!
TOWNSHIP_MENU_TRADER_COUNT_REMAINING: Find ${value} more to unlock for trading.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_TRADER_OUT_OF_TOWN: Trader is currently out of Town. They will arrive in ${value} ticks.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_TUTORIAL_CTA_1: Head over to the Tasks tab to get started with the Township Tutorial.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_TUTORIAL_CTA_2: Complete these Tasks to become familiar with the basics of Township.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_WELCOME_0: Welcome to Township! We recommend you take some time to explore the menus and get familiar with the Skill.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_WELCOME_1: Be sure to look at the TASKS section for tasks that provide rewards.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_WELCOME_RECOMMENDATION: You can change your Worship at any time after this screen. There is a 50M cost to do so.
TOWNSHIP_MENU_WELCOME_RECOMMENDATION_SWA: We recommend starting on Map 1 if you are new to Township.
You can restart your Town and select a new Map when you are comfortable with Biomes.
Would you like to select a different Map?
TOWNSHIP_MENU_XP_PER_TICK: +${value} Skill XP gained per tick (Includes Skill XP Bonuses).
TOWNSHIP_MENU_XP_PER_TICK_INFO: Skill XP per tick increases with your current Population.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Easy11_description: Hint: Use the Herblore Potion if you cannot create Tier 1 Potions normally.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_REQ_5: Discover ${qty1} / ${qty2} Points of Interest in ${skillIcon} Cartography World Map: ${worldName}
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_REQ_6: Refine ${mapIcon} Dig Site Maps in ${skillIcon} Cartography a total of ${qty1} / ${qty2} times
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task0_description: Increase your Population Cap by building Basic Shelters. Population determines the amount of XP you generate per tick. You also need basic resources like Food for your Citizens. It is very important to generate enough Food to feed your Town at all times. If you run out of Food, your population will begin to perish at a very fast rate.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task10_description: Increase your population again so we can reach Tier 2 buildings at 200 population and Level 15 Township. This will unlock even more building options for you.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task11_description: Upon reaching 200 population, Tier 2 Buildings will unlock. Increase your Happiness by building Taverns which helps with your XP rate. Cemeteries are where you store the Dead which helps with Happiness.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task12_description: Clothing is important as it is a requirement to build in Desert Biomes. Build a Tailor to start producing these. Clothing requires Leather.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task13_description: This is where I leave you to explore. You now have a basic functioning Town. Always be on the look out for negative Food and resources!
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task1_description: Build more Basic Shelters so more Citizens can move in. We need some basic resources like Wood to build more buildings. Build a Woodcutters Camp to generate Wood.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task2_description: We should always increase our Food production before we continue to expand. Build more Basic Shelters and Farmlands.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task3_description: Miner Pits provide more basic resources like Stone, Ore and Coal. Coal is required for buildings built in the Snowlands biome. Build a Miners Pit in the Mountains biome.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task4_description: Storage is important to keep resources plentiful. Build a Storehouse to store more resources.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task5_description: We need to create Bars to build better buildings. This comes from a Blacksmith and requires Ore & Coal from the Miners Pit to produce. Remember to keep your Food plentiful.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task6_description: We need more Ore & Coal! Expand your Town and build another Miners Pit. You can also upgrade your Basic Shelters to Wooden Huts which increases population.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task7_description: Upgrade more Basic Shelters, build more Food production and storage space.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task8_description: We need to produce more resources like Planks, which requires Wood. Expand your Town and build a Carpenters Workshop.
TOWNSHIP_TASKS_Task9_description: Expand your Town and begin collecting more basic resources like Leather and Herbs. Leather is used to make Clothing which allows your Citizens to work inside the Desert Biome. Herbs are used to make Potions which help your Health. Also build a School for Education which increases Town resource generation.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event0: On a tranquil day at an island, you choose to indulge in a refreshing swim at the beach. While venturing further into the water, you spot a radiant glow beneath you. As you dive and approach the luminous object, your excitement builds. It's not just one lemon, but an entire abundance of them!
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event1: You stumble upon some mischievous monkeys. Thinking they were up for some fun, they snatch the lemons from your pocket. As you chase after them, they hurl the lemons back at you with deadly precision, turning your head into a bullseye. You regain consciousness later with a pounding headache and zero lemons.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event10: As you stumble upon a wandering gambling ship, curiosity gets the best of you as you decide to test your luck at a daring game of lemon roulette. Against all odds, fortune favors you, and you emerge victorious, claiming an incredible prize.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event11: Spotting a shipwreck in the distance, you gaze upon the vessel's haunting silhouette stretching across the water. The imposing rock serves as a grim backdrop, a stark reminder of the unpredictability of the seas. Gentle waves caress the abandoned hull while seagulls hover above, eagerly anticipating their chance to seize a worthy treasure.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event12: Navigating through dense fog, you find yourself at the mercy of uncertain winds, making it increasingly challenging to steer your ship.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event13: Suddenly, a menacing fleet of pirates spots your presence, hungering for a battle. With remarkable skill, you engage in a fierce skirmish, emerging victorious while sustaining minor damages to your ship. Now, before setting off on your next adventure, you must repair your vessel.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event14: A small fleet of bloodthirsty pirates spots your ship, eager for a confrontation. Engaging in a fierce battle, you narrowly escape with sheer luck and your vessel suffers significant damages. Before venturing further you must invest resources to repair your ship.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event15: You notice a speck on the horizon, gradually revealing itself as a merchant vessel. They extend a warm welcome, inviting you aboard their ship. The captain's jovial nature and the crew's friendly hospitality create an atmosphere of camaraderie. Engrossed in conversation and tales of their adventures, you join them for a delightful dinner before retiring to your own quarters. With fond memories, you bid farewell to your newfound friends in the morning, setting sail once more on your ongoing journey.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event16: While navigating through the dense fog, you come across a looming ship emerging from the mist. Noticing the flag of a seemingly friendly vessel, you attempt to establish contact. Alas, no response is received, prompting you to cautiously approach for further investigation. However, the unexpected presence of pirates on their deck turns the situation into a harrowing encounter. Swiftly, you change course and flee, narrowly escaping their plundering assault. Fortunately, your ship endures only minor damage from the perilous chase.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event17: Today, the wind becomes your ally, propelling your ship effortlessly in the very direction you intended to sail.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event18: Fortune smiles upon you as a strong wind surges in your favor, propelling your ship with greater speed along the intended course.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event19: Casting your gaze upon the sea, you spot a mysterious object floating in the distance, which turns out to be a colossal shipwreck. Collecting scattered materials hastily, you make a swift exit before encountering the lurking danger responsible.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event2: Surprise! It's your birthday! You gain 1 lemon for each friend on your ship to celebrate with.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event20: As you encounter an island teeming with seemingly friendly monkeys, your misconception shatters when they cunningly snatch away portions of your precious ship's food supply.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event21: Exploring a small island, you stumble upon a bountiful array of plants adorned with delectable fruits, ready to satisfy your hunger.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event22: On a regular and brilliantly clear day, you seize the perfect opportunity to survey your surroundings for any nearby locations.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event3: You have discovered an oddly shaped rock formation. As you get closer to the formation, you realize there's a hidden area behind it! Searching this area behind it, you notice a golden chest! Hoping for something extremely rare,  you instead find a lemon.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event4: You stare out into the distance. The sea is a deep blue and the sky is a bright, crisp white. The sun is shining and there is a gentle breeze blowing. You can see broken planks and materials floating in the water. Upon closer inspection, you spot a Message in the Bottle floating. Theres some sort of map inside! It looks old and tattered, but you can still make out the details. This is leading me to a secret location!
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event5: While exploring a tiny island, you stumble upon a serene lake glistening under the sunlight. Something catches your eye! A shimmering key resting at the sandy bottom. As you retrieve the cool, intricate golden key, excitement bubbles within you, wondering what it may unlock on your adventure ahead.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event6: Venturing far out at sea, an unfamiliar island catches your eye. Docking and exploring its shores, a sense of deja vu washes over you. This is the very same place marked on a treasure map! Curiosity leads you deeper into the jungle, only to find an underwhelming scene. Undeterred, you dig into the ground, and with an unexpected thud, you uncover a gleaming Golden Golbin Statue!
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event7: While sailing on calm waters, you stumble upon a magnificent sight that seems to be a colossal golden crate floating in the water. Its surface mirrors the vivid sky above, radiating a captivating glow. You can't help but feel excited at the prospect of what might be inside.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event8: You found a Lemon floating in the sea, but it might be fake. You decide to grab it anyway due to your Lemon fetish.
TRAVEL_EVENT_Event9: While sailing the seas, you encounter a jovial trading ship in search of unique treasure. The traders, with their insatiable appetite for unique treasures, seem intrigued by your Golden Golbin Statues. Excitement fills the air as you declare your willingness to part with them, promising a generous return in GP for the statue's value.
TRAVEL_TO_HEXES_IS_FREE: Travelling to other hexes with ${groupName} is free.
TUTORIAL_CONTINUE_TUTORIAL: Continue Tutorial Island to unlock this Page.
TUTORIAL_CONTINUE_TUTORIAL_SHOP: Continue Tutorial Island to unlock this Shop Item.
TUTORIAL_MISC_1: Your personal guide to Melvor Idle
TUTORIAL_MISC_4: Head back to Tutorial Island to claim your Rewards.
TUTORIAL_MISC_6: You will miss out on important information and rewards. Are you sure you want to skip Tutorial Island?
TUTORIAL_MISC_9: The Tutorial has finished! It's up to you from now on. Go forth and begin your massive journey within Melvor Idle!
TUTORIAL_SHOP_LOCKED: This Shop Item is currently locked.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_0: Woodcutting is a basic Skill that provides Logs to create various weaponry and items. It is possible to find a Bird Nest while Woodcutting that provides Seeds for Farming.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_1: Firemaking provides bonuses to other Skills in the game at later stages of the game.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_10: We are now going to start the process of creating Arrows. Feathers are required, so let's buy some from the Shop before we move on.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_11: Arrows are then created in Fletching and require Arrow Shafts, Headless Arrows & Arrowtips (on top of the Feathers) to produce. Arrow Shafts produce a minimum of 15 from a Normal Log. This increases when using higher level Logs from Woodcutting.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_12: It is time to create our Bow. To do so, we need some Bowstring. This can be purchased in the Shop alongside many other Materials and Upgrades.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_13: The last step, making our Normal Shortbow. First, create the Normal Shortbow (U) and then the beautiful Normal Shortbow.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_14: It's time to equip our new Items. This is done in the Bank just like before.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_15: Time to test out your new Bow & Arrows. Defeat some Chickens using Ranged.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_16: Another approach to Combat is via the use of Magic. Magic Combat Spells use many different types of  Runes that are created in Runecrafting. All Runes require Rune Essence to make, which is obtained in Mining. Let's do that first before we move on.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_17: This is where you create all the Runes needed for Magic Combat Spells.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_18: The use of Magic Spells require a Magic Weapon to be equipped. Lucky we gave you one earlier. Equip it to enable Combat Magic.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_19: Time to test out your new Spells. Slay a Golbin using a Magic Combat Spell. You can select this in the Combat Screen.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_2: One main source of Food comes from Fishing. You can catch many different Fish here, and also find many rare and unique Special Items as well.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_20: Lastly we have Farming. You can plant seeds that grow over time to produce different Allotments, Herbs or Trees. This can be done alongside any Skill you are training. Seeds have a 50% chance to die unless you use COMPOST. Grab some from the Shop.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_21: Have a go at planting those Potato Seeds we gave you. Allotments require 3 Seeds to plant. I highly recommend you apply Compost to your Farming plot, but you don't have to if you believe luck will be on your side. Plants have feelings too you know.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_22: There is a Game Guide located at the top of every Page. If you need more information, just click the Page Icon! Take a look at the Combat Page Game Guide - this is the last step of the Tutorial.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_3: Your main Food production Skill. Cook Fish and Farming products here to keep you alive in your Combat adventures.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_4: Mining provides the resources required for most Melee Weapons and Armour. You can also find Rune Essence here which is used for Runecrafting.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_5: Smithing turns your Mining resources into products that can be used to create Melee Weapons and Armour, as well as some other good stuff.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_6: Weapons, Armour and Food can be equipped from the Bank. Give it a go so you are ready for battle!
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_7: Have a go at slaying one of the many unique Monsters you can locate in Melvor.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_8: Let's try a different style of Combat - Ranged. For this, you need a Bow and some Arrows. Gather some basic resources so we can get you started on Ammo.
TUTORIAL_TASK_DESC_9: When making Arrows, you need Arrowtips. These can be created in Smithing. 1 Bar produces 15 Arrowtips.
UNHOLY_PRAYERS_MSG_0: Unholy Prayers can only be used when you have at least 2 Unholy Items equipped.
UNHOLY_PRAYERS_MSG_1: Unholy Prayer effects scale with the number of Unholy Mark stacks on the enemy. An Unholy Mark stack is consumed each time an Unholy Prayer uses Prayer Points.
UNLOCKED_HEX_MASTERY_FOR_MAP: You have unlocked a new mastery bonus for Cartography map: ${worldName}!
UNLOCK_TRAVEL_FOR_FREE: Unlock the ability to travel to other hexes with ${groupName} for free.
UPGRADED_MAP_TIMES: You upgraded your ${digSiteName} Dig Site Map ${count} times
VIEW_ON_OFFICIAL_WIKI: View on the Official Wiki (External Link)
WHAT_IS_HEX_MASTERY_0_HTML: When a Hex is surveyed up to Level 5, it will become "Mastered". When a certain number of Hexes have been "Mastered", you will unlock bonuses as listed.
WHAT_IS_HEX_MASTERY_1_HTML: Initially, only Point of Interest and Dig Site Hexes can be surveyed to Level 5. All other Hexes can only be surveyed to Level 2 (Excluding the starting zone).
WHAT_IS_HEX_MASTERY_3_HTML: When the entire World Map has been Surveyed (Which nets you over Skill Level 100), you will unlock the ability to Survey all remaining Hexes to Level 5.
WOODCUTTING_REALM_ERROR: You cannot cut Trees from different Realms at the same time.
